channel.title: Xgboost on Just my blog
channel.description: Recent content in Xgboost on Just my blog

item.title: XGBoost applied to Fashion MNIST
item.description: Now let’s consider applying XGBoost to Fashion MNIST dataset. As well as in 2 previous posts about XGBoost data are eready to use, and do not require any additional preprocessing in order to get accuracy near 90%. This makes this case similar to previous two (Iris and MNIST).

item.title: XGBoost applied to MNIST
item.description: Continue playing with XGBoost. Today let’s apply it to MNIST dataset. In fact, there is very small difference between applying XGBoost to Iris or to MNIST. I will not comment much here, and just give here a python script with the solution. If something is unclear, go read my previous post about XGboost and Iris.

item.title: XGBoost applied to Iris dataset
item.description: Let’s show here a very simple example of applying XGBoost to Iris dataset. Initial Iris dataset is at UCI data repository. But we will use ready-to-use Iris dataset contained in sklearn.
